PresentationRequest.title: PresentationRequest
PresentationRequest.description: Represents a request from a user to receive a private presentation about opera reservation packages.

id.description: Unique identifier for the presentation request.

name.description: The name of the user requesting the presentation.

email.description: The email address of the user requesting the presentation.

message.description: A message from the user providing additional context or information for the presentation request.

requestDateTime.description: The date and time when the presentation request was submitted.

definition.description: Stores presentation requests submitted by users.  No denormalized authorization fields are needed, as access control is based on public read/write.

params.name: presentationRequestId
params.description: The unique ID of the presentation request document.

firestore.reasoning:
Given the requirement to store presentation requests, a straightforward collection structure is recommended. A single collection, `presentationRequests`, will house all request documents. This simplifies data management and querying.  

Authorization Independence: Since there are no hierarchical relationships or nested data, authorization is simple: there's no need to denormalize any data for authorization purposes. All writes are public (no login required). The structure facilitates QAPs since listing presentation requests will have the same security posture for all documents in the collection. This prevents listing documents that should be hidden.

Clarity of Intent:  The collection name `presentationRequests` clearly indicates its purpose. Each document within the collection represents a single presentation request, making the structure easy to understand and maintain.
